return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Represents the parser to handle commands.

return (new DukeException("ERROR: there is no item in the list there!").getMessage());
return (new DukeException("ERROR: please specify an index.").getMessage());
* Method to show contents of list.

return ("Got it. I've added this task: \n"
+ (TaskList.taskList.size() > 1 ? " tasks in your list." : " task in your list."));
+ (TaskList.taskList.size() > 1 ? " tasks in your list." : " task in your list."));
return ("Nice! I've marked this task as done:" + "\n" + "  " + TaskList.taskList.get(index).toString());
return ("Nice! I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + TaskList.taskList.get(index).toString());

DeadlineTask deadline = new DeadlineTask("This is a test description", "01-10-2000 1800");
assertEquals(deadline.toString(), "[D][ ] This is a test description (by: Sunday, 1 October 2000 6:00 PM)");
DeadlineTask deadline = new DeadlineTask("This is a test description", "01-10-2000 1800");
assertEquals(deadline.toString(), "[D][X] This is a test description (by: Sunday, 1 October 2000 6:00 PM)");
TodoTask todo = new TodoTask("This is a test description");
assertEquals(todo.toString(), "[T][ ] This is a test description");
TodoTask todo = new TodoTask("This is a test description");
assertEquals(todo.toString(), "[T][X] This is a test description");
